import React, { useState } from "react" import { Card, CardBody, Col, Row, CardTitle, Label, Input, } from "reactstrap" //Import Breadcrumb import Breadcrumbs from "../../components/Common/Breadcrumb" const BasicElements = () => { const [customchk, setcustomchk] = useState(true) const [toggleSwitch, settoggleSwitch] = useState(true) function check(e) { let tecla = (document.all) ? e.keyCode : e.which; //Tecla de retroceso para borrar, siempre la permite if (tecla === 45) { e.preventDefault(); return true; } return false; } return (
Textual inputs

Here are examples of .form-control applied to each textual HTML5 <input>{" "} type.

{ return check(e) }} defaultValue="42" id="example-number-input" />
Sizing

Set height using className like .form-control-lg and .form-control-sm.

Range Inputs

Create custom <input type="range">{" "} controls with .form-range.

Checkboxes
Form Checkboxes
Form Check Right
false} checked={customchk} />
Radios
Default Radios
Form radio right
 Switches

A switch has the markup of a custom checkbox but uses the .form-switch class to render a toggle switch. Switches also support the disabled attribute.

{ settoggleSwitch(!toggleSwitch) }} />
File browser

The file input is the most gnarly of the bunch and requires additional JavaScript if you’d like to hook them up with functional Choose file… and selected file name text.

) } export default BasicElements
